p: In terms of their antiviral activity, dermaseptins have been shown to be highly effective against a broad range of viral pathogens, with activity that affects several steps in the infection and replication process. Dermaseptin-1 was initially identified to have antiviral activity against two viruses that are known to infect ectothermic animals; Frog virus 3 from the family Iridoviridae, and Channel catfish virus, a member of the Herpesviridae family (Chinchar et al. 2004). This study provided indication that dermaseptin peptides possessed antiviral activity and subsequent studies were extended to examine the activity against human viral pathogens.
